Cell.Data: Anything between straight brackets - i.e. [ ] - is a formatting tag. Do not change these tags and keep them in the same relative position in the text. Anything between curly brackets - i.e. { } - is a place where text or numbers will be inserted by the game. Do not change the tag, but feel free to change its position in the text to suit the localized text.

In the text below, any inserted strings - anything of the form {text} - is replaced by an integer value for the thing described in the brackets. If the {text} is not followed by a unit - e.g. shields, hitpoints - the icon for the unit is inserted together with the integer. The same holds for symbols - e.g. '+', '%' - which are occasionally inserted together with the integer.
For references to game terminology and in-world references, please check the glossary delivered as part of the documentation.

Target friendly unit with an Explosive attack gains +{AdvancedMunitionsProvisionRange} range, +{AdvancedMunitionsProvisionDamage}% damage and [abilityred]Massive Impact[/abilityred] for {AdvancedMunitionsProvisionDuration}[turn/].

Artillery fire rains on a {hexrad} hex radius area, dealing {CreepingBarrageDamage}[damagephysical/] damage with [abilityred]High Impact[/abilityred]. This triggers at the start of each of your turns for {CreepingBarrageDuration}[turn/], and the radius is increased by 1 hex each turn.
Artillery fire rains down on a {hexrad} hex radius area, dealing {CreepingBarrageDamage}[damagephysical/] damage at the start of the next turn.

Drop a flare on target {hexrad} hex radius area, giving [abilityred]Illuminated[/abilityred] to units who stand there, making them {TimeOnTargetAccuracy}% easier to hit.[br/]At the start of the next turn, the area is hit with artillery fire, dealing {TimeOnTargetDamage}[damagephysical/] damage and applies [abilityred]Massive Impact[/abilityred] to any units that are not immune.

A tactical nuclear missile lands in a {TacticalNuclearStrikeAoE} hex radius area with [abilityred]Massive Impact[/abilityred], dealing {TacticalNuclearStrikeCenterDamage}[damagethermal/] damage in the center. Each additional hex away from the center reduces this damage.[br/]In addition, every enemy unit in combat has a {TacticalNuclearStrikeBlindStrength}[strengthphysical/] strength chance to become [abilityred]Blinded[/abilityred].
